intro: Phillyrea bolivaris subsp. foliosa, commonly known as the Bolivian Phillyrea, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the Oleaceae family and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a slow growth rate and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
